resources.string: Matrices must be of the same size to perform this operation.
Columns of matrix 1 should equal rows of matrix 2.
Fill in all cells before performing an operation.
1. To add and subtract matrices, they must be of the same size
2. To multiply matrices, the number of columns of matrix A must be equal to the number of rows of B
The determinant is found only for a square matrix
Inverse matrix is found only for a square matrix
This part of the application implements a matrix calculator that implements the basic functions for working with matrices.
You are greeted by the main page of the matrix calculator.
3. Choosing the dimension of the matrix
9. Select a matrix on which operations will be carried out
This is what the window of the result of one of the operations looks like.
You can also refer to the helper for the basics for working with matrices.
This part of the application is responsible for working with the smartphone database and phone book.
First, we are greeted by a form for adding a new smartphone, in which we need to select a picture, fill in the fields of model, company, screen diagonal, warehouse address and price.
There is a hint for the company field.
There is also validation for each field.
Next, we can view all smartphones previously added to the database. We can filter by company and screen, and also display the average diagonal of all smartphones.
We can build a route between our current location and the warehouse address of this smartphone.
We can also edit and delete the smartphone from the database.
We can also see the entire list of contacts from our smartphone and sort it by last name size
